metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12770 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.6.11. sg_write lacksan sg_remove_request call in a certain failure case, aka CID-83c6f2390040.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-40-generic - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-5.4.0-40-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-40-generic - 5.4.0-40.44
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-40-lowlatency - 5.4.0-40.44
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1018-kvm - 5.4.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-gcp - 5.4.0-1019.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-oracle - 5.4.0-1019.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1011-oem - 5.6.0-1011.11
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1013-raspi - 5.4.0-1013.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-40.44').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1018.18').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1020.20').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1019.19').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1019.19').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1011.11').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1013.13').
